reviews.review_msg: She talks quietly so sit close if you want to know what's going on. Definitely recommend attending lectures and READ entire BOOK before coming to class. Sometimes she tells you to read a couple of chapters of a book, then she starts to talk about the ending of the book. A couple papers but if you go to office hours, it should be easy

Steve is the most cool professor I have ever seen. He is flexible with the deadlines of the submissions, he is very familiar with the students and most importantly he is a very easy grader. You should know very basic english to get an above average grade.

He is a chill and nice person. However, books in this class are boring. He always marks papers by his own strange criteria. I got a B and my GPA went down so his class is not a GPA booster as you could think.
Congratulations, you just made one of the greatest decisions of your life if you chose him as your prof.

I thought the prof was great! She explained the stories we had to read in her weekly podcasts and I learned a lot from them. For a first year course, I thought the grading was pretty hard though. There was 2 journal entries and 2 essays and the grading is very subjective as it's based on how your TA perceives it.
One of the Ã­ntructors that I really admire so far. Very passionate about teaching, very inspirational lectures. Work hard and youll get the mark you deserve. Highly recommended!

Annette stenning I believe she was hurt in her childhood or something becoz the readings she made you read are very depressing !!! A women hurt by love thats why she would let you read all the bad books! Don't be brainwashed by Annette while she telling you that you are stupid because you can't read Heart of Darkness! Get a life Annette!

The topic were ones you would talk about in grade 9/10 and talks to students as if we don't know anything. Lectures were very bland and pointless. It was mostly related to video games but not even ones our generation could relate to. When I had asked a question about something I received a very cold response making me feel bad for even asking.

I don't like giving low ratings. Although she is a good professor I would say that they mark english papers too hard. It's almost like they forget this course is for students who just came to university. I tried really hard for both my papers but I only got a B. I actually do well in English, so it was quite a surprise. So yeah.

So disappointed... I saw so many good reviews of Stephen on this site, but it looks like this semester he decided to approach the course differently. The course is so politically heavy that if I dropped in for one lecture, the last thing I would think of it to be is an English course. As a result, tutorial discussions are extremely dry :(

Super passionate about the course content which made lectures engaging, and really helped us understand complicated stories/poems. Just 2 essays a final, and a tutorial where you have to participate. Keep up with the readings and listen in lecture and you'll be fine

I found her teaching style very relaxing - super chill (although I can see how some people might find it boring in comparison) and the readings weren't bad at all. Grading is harsh but I found the feedback helpful, TA dependant though I guess? Overall I'd take her again!

She seems like a nice prof but I've only ever seen her through pre-recorded lectures. Weekly homework assignments were only for completion marks so it's not hard to do well in this class. Studied so hard for the final but I did so bad lol that's probably my fault though

Professor Gilles was very disconnected from the class. The lectures consisted of Youtube videos we could easily google ourselves and the occasional video by her. Grading criteria could've been explained better. She talks VERY slow so all of her videos were watched at 2x speed. The weekly course load was light and it wasn't hard to get a good mark.

She has really interesting lectures and always encourages people to participate. The books we are covering are really great and I learned so much in this course. Overall, I enjoyed learning with her and would really suggest other people to take ENG 112 if they have a chance to.
